resources.string: Parliament Hill, colloquially known as The Hill, is an area of Crown land on the southern banks of the Ottawa River.
This is the largest single set of locks on the entire Rideau system, providing a lift of 24 m (79 ft.).
Rideau Hall is the official residence and workplace of every governor general since 1867.
Confederation Square is considered the second most important ceremonial centre in Canada\'s capital city, after Parliament Hill.
Westboro Village is one of the most unique and diverse neighbourhoods in Ottawa.
Dow\'s Lake in Ottawa, Canada is a small man-made lake on the Rideau Canal.
The Canadian Museum of Nature is a natural history museum.
The Canadian Museum of History is Canada\'s national museum of human history.
The Canadian War Museum is Canada\'s national museum of military history.
The National Gallery of Canada is one of Canada\'s premier art galleries.
The Canada Aviation and Space Museum
The Canada Aviation and Space Museum is Canada\'s national aviation history museum.
Rideau canal was opened in 1832 as a precaution in case of war with the United States. It remains in use today primarily for pleasure boating.
The Sir John A. Macdonald Parkway, formerly the Ottawa River Parkway, is a four-lane scenic parkway along the Ottawa River.
The Hog\'s Back Falls are a series of artificial waterfalls on the Rideau River.
Major\'s Hill Park is a park in downtown Ottawa, Ontario. The park stands above the Rideau Canal at the point where it enters the Ottawa River.
Lansdowne Park is a 40-acre historic sports, exhibition and entertainment facility.
he Rideau Falls are two waterfalls where the Rideau River empties into the Ottawa River.
Daily sightseeing tours with full live commentary, and evening cocktail cruises complete with live music await you.
Experience the sights, sounds and scents of the Ottawa Region on a bicycle!
Guided wilderness canoe trip in Algonquin Park. Paddle your own canoe, swim in pristine lakes, cook over a campfire, and sleep in tents.
Ottawa City Rafting specializes in whitewater rafting, canoeing, fishing and sea kayaking tours.
Ottawa Biplane Adventures offers a bird\'s-eye view of Ottawa\'s most beautiful locations, all in the seat of an open cockpit Biplane.
